contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=October 2009}} {{Infobox person | name =Ottomar Anschütz | image =Anschuetz.jpg | image_size = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date|1846|5|16|df=y}} | birth_place =[[Leszno|Lissa]], [[Kingdom of Prussia|Prussia]] | death_date = {{Death date and age|1907|5|20|1846|5|16|df=y}} | death_place =[[Berlin]], [[German Empire]] | death_cause = | resting_place = | resting_place_coordinates = | residence = | nationality =[[Germany|German]] | other_names = | known_for =[[Photography]] | education = | employer = | occupation = | title = | salary = | networth = | height = | weight = | term = | predecessor = | successor = | party = | boards = | religion = | spouse = | partner = | children = | parents = | relatives = | signature = | website = | footnotes = }} '''Ottomar Anschütz''' (16 May 1846 in German Lissa – 30 May 1907 in Berlin) was a German inventor, photographer, and [[chronophotographer]]. ==Biography== He invented 1/1000 of a second [[shutter (photography)|shutter]], and the "electrotachyscope" in 1887. The electrotachyscope was a disk of 24 glass diapositives, manually powered, and illuminated by a sparking [[spiral]] [[Geissler tube]], used by a single viewer, or projected to a small group. In 1887 Anschütz developed the Projecting [[Electrotachyscope]], in 1891 a slightly smaller, powered version, the "[[Electrical Schnellseher]]" (i.e. quick viewer), was being manufactured by [[Siemens & Halske]] in Berlin, used in a public [[arcade (architecture)|arcade]] and was displayed at the International Electrotechnical Exhibition in [[Frankfurt]]. Nearly 34,000 people paid to see it at the Berlin Exhibition Park in summer 1892 also [[Strand, London]] and at the 1893 [[World's Columbian Exposition|Chicago World's Fair]]. His 1884 [[albumen]] [[photography]] of [[storks]] inspired [[aviation]] pioneer [[Otto Lilienthal]]'s experimental [[Glider aircraft|gliders]] in the late 1880s. ==External links== {{commons category|Ottomar Anschütz}} *{{Victorian Cinema|anschutz.htm}} * [http://www.victorian-cinema.net/machines.htm#electricalschnellseher "Schnellseher" and "Electrotachyscope"] * [http://www.fotoerbe.de/index.php?t=zahlen&s=suchanzeige3&tagsuch=Ansch%FCtz,%20Ottomar&kn=Fotografen Collections with photographs taken by Ottomar Anschütz] * [http://www.lilienthal-museum.de/olma/efoto.htm photography of storks and moving pictures of the flight of a crane in his "Schnellseher" (quick-viewer)] * [http://www.lilienthal-museum.de/olma/ebarchi.htm#1 Photographs of Lilienthal's flights in 1893/94] * [http://www.xs4all.nl/~lommen9/goerz/index.html Goerz Photographing Experiments and the first flight of Otto Lilienthal ] *{{Cite NIE|Anschütz, Ottomar|year=1905}} {{Authority control|VIAF=32179484}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Anschutz, Ottomar | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH =16 May 1846 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Leszno|Lissa]], [[Prussia]] | DATE OF DEATH =20 May 1907 | PLACE OF DEATH =[[Berlin, Germany]] }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Anschutz, Ottomar}} [[Category:German photographers]] [[Category:German inventors]] [[Category:People of the German Empire]] [[Category:1846 births]] [[Category:1907 deaths]] {{Germany-photographer-stub}} {{Germany-engineer-stub}}
